page.title: 16The Hearing Impaired Unit.
page.content: There are 2 units in Belford,1 in the First,and 1 in the Middle School,with a specially trained teacher of the deaf in each.There are 7 children in the First,and 5 in the Middle School unit.They travel long distances,from Amble in the South,Eyemouth in the North,and Alnham in the West of the County.Belford was chosen to house the units because of its central position and its proximity to the main A.1.road which enables the children to come to school in the winter. The children are taught to speak rather than tomake signs.They integrate with hearing children in order to learn to be like them.The teachers have to deal with a wide range of deafness.All the children have hearing aids _some post_aural, some body_worn aids and some phonic ears.
